Confidential Information shall include, without limitation, all writings, memoranda, copies, reports, records, papers, surveys, analyses, drawings, letters, computer printouts, computer programs (source and object code), computer applications, computer processing techniques, methodologies, proposals, bids, processes, specifications, customer data (such as customer lists, identities, and requirements), contacts, licenses, business methods, business processes, business techniques, business plans, financial records, Contractor compensation, marketing plans, data, graphs, charts, sound recordings, pictorial representations, inventions, prototypes, and samples (whether or not patentable or copyrightable).

b. During the Employment with the Company or at any time thereafter, the Employee shall not disclose information relating to the affairs of the Company to any person not legally entitled thereto, nor shall he/she disclose to any person whatsoever any information that comes to his/her knowledge as a result of or arising out of his/her employment hereunder and relating to the affairs of the Company or which is personal to the Company and/or its officers and employees.

c. Notwithstanding termination/expiry of this Agreement, the obligations in relation to Confidential Information shall survive and be enforceable till such time until Confidential Information has been either returned by the receiving Party to the disclosing Party or destroyed by the receiving Party (at the instructions of the disclosing Party), but in no case shall exceed three (3) years from the date of Expiry or Termination of this Agreement;

d. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary in this Agreement, each Party and its representatives may disclose, without liability under this Agreement, any Confidential Information if such disclosure is (i) reasonably believed by it to be compelled or required by, or advisable to be disclosed under, any law, rule, regulation or governmental request, court decree or other legal, administrative, governmental or regulatory request, order or proceeding, (ii) necessary or appropriate in connection with any litigation or other proceeding to which it or any of its affiliates is a party, or (iii) otherwise in connection with the protection or enforcement of rights relating to the Agreement;
e. In case of breach of obligations relating to Confidential Information, the Employee shall be liable to any and all civil and criminal actions.

p.b: 5. DELIVERY OF MATERIALS UPON TERMINATION OF SERVICE
p.p: Upon expiry or termination of this Agreement, the Employee shall promptly, but in any event no later than three (3) days thereafter, deliver to the Employer any (i) Property belonging to the Employer or its customers and (ii) Documents or copies, in whatever form, of all Confidential Information in the Employee’s possession or power. The Employee shall also delete and destroy all Confidential Information that it may have stored, saved or retained on any system, storage or medium under the Employee’s possession or control including but not limited to the Employee ’s personal server.

a.“Intellectual Property” means all form of intellectual property rights throughout the world including but not limited to present and future copyright, registered and unregistered trademarks, patent, design, rights, trade mark, any other intellectual or industrial property rights, discovery, invention, secret process or improvement in procedure of any kind whether arising from statute, under common law or in equity and confidential information including know-how and trade secrets;

b. The Parties acknowledge and agree that the Employer is and shall be the sole and exclusive owner of all Intellectual Property Rights in all works produced by the Employee during the course of its employment with the Employer.

div.p:
7. MISCELLANEOUS
a. Notices
Any notice to be issued under this Agreement must be in writing and delivered to the recipient’s regular contact address or email address or to the attention of such other person as the recipient Party will have specified by prior written notice;
b. Severability
Whenever possible, each provision of this Agreement will be interpreted in such manner as to be effective and valid under applicable law. If, however, any provision of this Agreement is deemed or held to be void, illegal, invalid or unenforceable by any court of competent jurisdiction, this Agreement shall be considered divisible and inoperative as to such provision to the extent it is deemed to be illegal, invalid or unenforceable, and in all other respects this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect; provided, however, that if any provision of this Agreement is deemed or held to be void, illegal, invalid or unenforceable by any court of competent jurisdiction, such provision shall be replaced with a provision by the Parties that is legal, valid and enforceable and that will achieve, to the greatest extent possible, the economic, business and other purposes of such invalid or unenforceable provision. Further, should any provision contained in this Agreement ever be reformed or rewritten by any judicial body of competent jurisdiction, such provision as so reformed or rewritten shall be binding upon the Parties hereto.
c. Complete Agreement
This Agreement embodies the complete agreement and understanding among the Parties with regard to the subject matter hereof and supersedes any prior understandings, agreements or representations by or among the Parties, written or oral, which may have related to the subject matter hereof in any way.
d. Governing Law
All questions concerning the construction, validity and interpretation of this Agreement will be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Pakistan.
